articles.title: Friendshoring Copper: A New Pillar of the U.S.-Brazilian Economic Partnership
articles.summary: Brazil is rich in critical minerals and rapidly becoming a copper hotspot. While China has established a dominant position in Brazil’s mining sector, U.S. engagement remains limited. The U.S. must step up with financing, supply-chain integration, and smarter trade tools.

articles.title: U.S.-EU Tech Tensions: Escalation or Diffusion?
articles.summary: U.S.–EU tensions over digital sovereignty are fueling global concerns about whether countries can control domestically used technologies. These disputes are not new and are unlikely to subside soon, given diverging regulatory philosophies and reliance on U.S. firms.
